greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of square divisors of central binomial coefficients.
link: Michel Marcus, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..120
example: n=27: binomial(27,1) = 20058300, its largest square-divisor is 900=30^2 so a(27) = tau(30) = 8.
mathematica: Table[Count[Divisors@ Binomial[n, Floor[n/2]], d_ /; IntegerQ@ Sqrt@ d], {n, 0, 84}] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Feb 18 2017 *)
program: (PARI) a(n) = sumdiv(binomial(n, n\2), d, issquare(d)); \\ _Michel Marcus_, Feb 19 2017
results.author: _Labos Elemer_ Jul 26 2000
